lines.text: [Barry answers the phone in the midst of reading his notes about the forthcoming day's presumed events]
Mom, I'll call you back. The day's repeating.
[Lisa and Barry are just meeting, and he is badly fumbling the conversation]

[amused]
Where are you usually locked up?
Oh, I'm just an experiment gone horribly awry in the Personnel Department.
I see. I'm Lisa Fredericks.
I'm Barry Thomas.

[not sure how to take him]
What is it that you do?
Oh, nothing. I just sort of boost morale in between threats of being fired.
Ah. Well, you seem to have a mind. That doesn't usually fit in this system. Nice to meet you.
[She turns away dismissively]
[Barry and Howard watch Lisa across the lunchroom after Barry's first disastrous attempt to meet her]
So, uh, she likes me. A lot. Wouldn't you agree?
Yeah. I'd say, like, you and a vicious ice cream headache are probably neck and neck.
Do I always sound like such an idiot or, or do I just save it for the people I really want to impress?
[waking on the "second" morning, Barry realizes that his potted geranium, which he had drunkenly broken the night before, is now intact again]
*One* of us fell down last night.
[Howard enters Barry's cubicle after Barry's second disastrous attempt to chat up Lisa]
How'd it go?
Oh, good, good, thanks. I'll be alone for the rest of my life, but good.
[Barry encounters Lisa in the food line again on the "second" day]
I'm sorry about the way that I came at you this morning. It must have been a bit of a shock, huh?

[chilly]
Are you assuming this morning's encounter has made us friends and we're now going to have a conversation?
No! No, no, no, no, no, God no! That's the last thing on my mind!
Good.
[to the food server]
Can I have some string beans and rice, please, Rico?
I just hate meeting new, and interesting, and attractive people. Don't you even think of starting up a conversation with *me*! Can I please have some macaroni?
[Barry's supervisor has just learned that he trespassed into a top-security area]
I like you, Barry, I really do. You're fired. Give me your ID and clean out your office by the end of today.
[he hands her his ID badge and starts to walk out, then turns back]
You know what's funny? If today was really today, I woulda quit by now.
[Jackson looks baffled]
[Barry has successfully saved Lisa on the "third" day and describes how he had tried to meet and warn her]
I mean, you saved my life.

Self-interest. I, I've been watching you out of my office for such a long time. The other day, I gathered up the nerve to actually speak to you. I made a fool out of myself, but I thought, "Hey, I'll, I'll have another chance to speak to you some day, right?" But then you... well.
We spoke?
Yeah! Yeah, we did.

[shy]
How was I?
You were great. You were very nice. You threw me out of your office.

[she smiles and takes a step closer to him]
I'm sorry. I guess I was having a bad day.
That next morning, when I saw you alive, I realized I had a second chance. A chance to save you...
[she steps closer and silences him with a kiss]

[to Lisa]
I am not gonna let you die again.
[they awake in bed after having made love in front of the fire]
You know, I'm usually not this type of guy.
I'm supposed to say that. What time is it?
No! We've got to do something!
There's no time. Quick, tell me what your favorite color is.
What?
Just, what's your favorite color?
Green.

[with increasing urgency]
Ah, your favorite food!
Smoked oysters.
Your favorite number.

[laughs]
37-point-1.
Your favorite music!
Oh, that's hard to answer...
No, come on, just tell me!
I'm embarrassed...
What is it?
The Carpenters.
The Carpenters. You gotta be kidding. Lisa, I love you.
[as Barry reaches his office cubicle on the "fourth" morning, his supervisor comes over to deliver her usual tirade, which this time he cuts off]
Well, look who decided to show up.

Oh, Anne, don't get your panties in a bunch. If you just left us alone, the work could get done. But no, you're so damn invasive that no one can concentrate around here. So just stop assuming that we're all idiots, and don't you judge people by how cute they are!
[Anne Jackson is taken aback. Howard raises his head high enough over the cubicle wall that we can see by his expression that he's impressed]
Well. This is what I get for covering you for all these years.

[with an evil whisper]
Thank you.
Well, it might be time to take a look into your performance record!

[with an evil grin]
You do that.

[tears developing in her eyes and voice]
Well, nice knowing you, Barry.
[she walks away, and Howard raises his head again to show an expression of awe at Barry's out-of-character chutzpah]

[on the "fourth" day, Barry is still trying to prove to Lisa that he knows about the time-loop Bounce. Barry takes Lisa's arm and points across the department to the hallway where Denk is entering, and again directs her attention to his time-line notes]

Look. Over there. See that? He's, he's about to light his cigarette. He's met you in the hallway these past few mornings, but today he can't, because you're here with me. What we have to do is keep Denk from finding out about the computer disk. So, today, I'll take all the information, all right?

[whispering]
I can't just accept this.
Fly to Heaven.
[she looks at him with deep uncertainty]

[to Lisa]
You're not killed today! That's great news!

[to Lisa]
You really like me a lot. You just can't remember it.
You know, we had a lot more fun last night.

[amused]
We did?
Yeah, we took a walk in the woods, and we sat by a fire...
We sat by a fire?
Yeah.
Are you saying that you, that we, I mean - Did you get lucky?
[His smile fades as she stares at him]
Oh my God. You got lucky!
You got lucky, too!
[Barry, Lisa and Howard are accosted by two men with guns]

[to Lisa]
These are the guys that've been killing you.
[Lisa and Barry hide from the gunmen after one of them shot Howard]
I'm sorry about your friend, Barry. I know you cared about him.
That's funny. He said the same thing to me when you were killed.
[Lisa enters her office to find Denk and Barry, whom she does not recognize, waiting for her]
The Time Bounce has happened.

[glances unbelievingly at Denk]
Excuse me?
The Time Bounce. We're in it. The Earth has stopped as we know it. Children don't grow up. People don't stay dead. We'll never have another holiday, and you'll never see another flower bloom.
What are you talking about?
because time passes.
Who is this... Who is this girl?
[Barry steps closer to her with each following comment]
37-point-1. Oysters. Green. The Carpenters. Fly to Heaven.
[she gazes at him in wonder]
[Barry strides over to Howard and hugs him]
Heyyyy, Howard, you're alive!
What are you talking about, man? I wasn't in the bathroom that long, was I?
[last lines]
We'll never know what'll happen next.

[smiling]
I know what'll happen next.
You do?
[she kisses him passionately]
You're gonna die of stress, Barry. It happens. It's happening to me!
Because if I wake up tomorrow and it's today, I'll kill myself.
Um, I dont know whats happened those other days, but I think we have to take it a little slower this time, okay?
It's too late for that... I died for you already.
